spell.name: Silver-Barbed Tongue

time.condition: which you take when a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself succeeds on an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw

entries: You magically distract the triggering creature and turn its momentary uncertainty into encouragement for another creature. The triggering creature must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract it from the {@dice d20}.

You can then choose a different creature you can see within range (you can choose yourself). The chosen creature gains a {@dice d4}, which it can choose to add to its AC for the attack if the triggering roll was an attack against them, or otherwise may add it to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes within 1 minute. A creature can be empowered by only one use of this spell at a time.
This spell replaces the spell {@spell Silvery Barbs}.

spell.name: Strike True
entries: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target you can see in range. Any gap in the target's defenses are highlighted by bright light that seems to glow out of it, shedding dim light in a 10-foot radius. As long as the spell lasts, attack rolls against the affected creature have advantage. However, after every attack following the first, you must make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration as though you had been struck by the attack yourself (though you take no damage).

The number of attacks that will not cause a Constitution save increases by one when you reach 5th level (two attacks), and again when you reach 11th level (three attacks) and 17th level (four attacks).
This spell replaces the spell {@spell True Strike}.
